answerText: the Gulf Stream[10] Ocean gyres are in part driven by this Swedish scientist's namesake phenomenon, in which surface water is dragged 90 degrees from the direction of the wind. He also names the resulting "spiral" as the water "transport" is propagated through layers of the ocean.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Harvard A | 18 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This current is part of the North Atlantic gyre. For 10 points each: [10] Name this current that warms both the southeastern United States and Western Europe with its continuation, the North Atlantic Drift.
